metadata.title: Convert Fahrenheit to Rankine – Temperature Converter
metadata.description: Convert temperature from Fahrenheit to Rankine scale, used in thermodynamics and engineering applications.

introduction: This converter transforms temperature measurements from Fahrenheit to Rankine, the absolute temperature scale used in engineering thermodynamics.
The Rankine scale is to Fahrenheit what Kelvin is to Celsius—an absolute temperature scale where zero represents absolute zero.
This converter enables precise thermodynamic calculations in US engineering applications.
methodology: The Rankine scale is used in engineering thermodynamics, steam tables, and HVAC calculations in US-based systems.
Absolute temperature is required for gas law and thermodynamic calculations.
This converter provides precise temperature conversions for engineering thermodynamics.

faqs.question: What is Rankine scale?
faqs.answer: An absolute temperature scale where zero is absolute zero (-459.67°F). Used in US engineering thermodynamics.

faqs.question: Why use Rankine instead of Fahrenheit?
faqs.answer: Thermodynamic equations require absolute temperatures. Rankine serves this purpose in US engineering.

faqs.question: How does Rankine relate to Kelvin?
faqs.answer: Both are absolute scales. Rankine = Kelvin × 1.8, preserving Fahrenheit degree size while using absolute zero reference.

glossary.definition: Absolute temperature scale based on Fahrenheit degrees.
Temperature measured from absolute zero reference.
